results.title: 64,000,000 years ago
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pacific Films, George Johnson, John Taylor and Bill Maylone
results.brief_description: This short animated film for children looks at the last of the great dinosaurs to stalk the central plains of North America. Lifelike models of ornithomimus, edmontosaur, and triceratops recreate the late Cretaceous period, offering a view of how our world may have looked 64,000,000 years ago. The soundtrack is filled with growls and roars with the occassional voice-over narration.

results.title: 60 second spot: the making of a television commercial
results.creator_credit: Mandlinfilm, Dotty Mandlin and Harvey Mandlin
results.brief_description: Traces the steps taken in creating and shooting a television commercial. Shows the cooperation between the advertising agency, the independent producer, and the individuals making the film, including the producer, director and actors. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: 60 cycles [French version]
results.brief_description: The 11th. St Laurent long distance cycling race with participants from 13 countries covers 1500 miles of the Quebec countryside in 12 days. From a distance, the cyclists are a moving colour frieze against the picturesque landscape; closer we see the taut faces and straining limbs of the competitiors above the bright circle of their machines.

results.title: 60 cycles
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet and Jean-Claude Labrecque
results.brief_description: The 11th St. Laurent long-distance cycle race; with participants from thirteen countries; and fifteen hundred miles of Quebec countryside to cover in twelve days. From a distance the cyclists are a moving colourful frieze against the picturesque landscape; closer, we see the taut faces and straining limbs of the competitors above the bright circles of their machines. (Awards: Moscow, London, Prague, New York, Cork)

results.title: 60's Rock Legends
results.creator_credit: John Heyman, World Film Services and Peter Clifton
results.brief_description: During the second half of the sixties and into the seventies, Peter Clifton took his cameras and crew from Hyde Park to the Paris Olympia. He was afforded a rare insight into the inner workings of the most explosive phase of rock history. The video includes clips from the Rolling Stones, Jimi Hendrix, Pink Floyd and many more.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Heyman, World Film Services and Peter Clifton

results.title: 6 scary stories
results.brief_description: Suitable for ages 2-8. Illustrations from the books are brought alive through animation and iconographic techniques. The stories range from a variation on the Hansel and Gretel theme where three boys venture too far into a forest inhabited by an evil witch-woman, to nine cats bearing a coffin through a foreboding cemetery with the gravedigger’s cat growing restless, to a journey on a dark, dark moor, through a dark, dark wood. Honoured by award after award at film festivals all over the world, this series of programs are the perfect bridge between video and children’s reading. Titles contained in this volume: “Teeny-Tiny and the witch woman”; “Attic of the wind”; “King of the cats”; “What’s under my bed?”; “Goggles!”; “A Dark, dark tale”.

results.title: 5BX plan for physical fitness. Chart 1-5
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Walford Hewitson and Bill Rice
results.brief_description: The Royal Canadian Air Force show the five basic exercises that keep their airmen trim, lively and alert. These are the same exercises as those presented in the R.C.A.F. booklet of the same title. Produced for The Royal Canadian Air Force.

results.title: 55 days at Peking
results.creator_credit: Samuel Bronston Productions, Samuel Bronston and Nicholas Ray
results.brief_description: During the Boxer Rebellion of 1900, a group of “foreigners” are trapped inside the Forbidden City of Peking under seige by thousands of rebellious Chinese who are determined to break free from the bonds of Imperialist intervention. Charlton Heston stars as the US Marine who leads the defence, while David Niven is the British Ambassador. The Dowager Empress (Flora Robson), and her chief advisor (Sir Robert Helpmann), try to play both sides against each other. Ava Gardner, as the beautiful Russian Countess, must make a choice between freedom and commitment.

results.title: 5000 Dumps
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley Productions, United States. Environmental Protection Agency and Stuart Finley
results.brief_description: A national survey of solid waste disposal practices revealed “problem” disposal areas. These sites contribute to air and water pollution, and are a health hazard. Visits some of the unsightly dumps throughout the U.S., and describes how they can be eliminated by citizen interest and Government action.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stuart Finley Productions, United States. Environmental Protection Agency and Stuart Finley

results.title: 50,000 Lives
results.creator_credit: M P O Productions, Johnson and Johnson and Baltimore Fire Dept
results.brief_description: The method and value of mouth to mouth resuscitation. Fifty thousand people die needlessly each year from asphyxia after an accident. This could be prevented by prompt application of mouth to mouth rescue breathing. Diagrams show why this method of resuscitation is so much more effective than others, and detailed demonstrations are given on live patients, adult and child. The use of a plastic airway is shown, and how to care for the patient as natural breathing commences.
